summary: William K. Harvey was a CIA personnel member, as indicated by multiple documents. He was assigned to the Berlin Base and was associated with the Technical Aids Detachment (TAD) in Frankfurt, Germany. He was issued a Federal Aviation Agency credential in 1963. Later, he was interviewed regarding his background and knowledge of assassination plots within the CIA, specifically concerning Operation ZRRIFLE, which involved the recruitment, development, and security protocols for clandestine agents. Information about Harvey was also reportedly provided to the Soviets by Robert Glenn Thompson. He retired from the CIA, as indicated by correspondence regarding his retirement and personnel action requests detailing his assignments and salary adjustments.
significance: William K. Harvey's significance in the JFK assassination context stems from his involvement in alleged assassination plots within the CIA, particularly his knowledge and role in Operation ZRRIFLE. His testimony and interviews related to these plots, along with his general background within the CIA, make him a person of interest in understanding potential CIA connections to the assassination.
